intro: Dontospermum pygmaeum, commonly known as the dwarf starfruit, is a small shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellow-orange berries that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a humid environment to flourish. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
